question: 181. Which of the following is not a valid attribute for an elastic network interface?
options: A. An IPv6 address
B. An IPv4 address
D. A routing table
C. A source/destination check flag
answers: D. A routing table

question: 182. Why might you use an elastic IP address?
options: C. You want to mask the failure of an instance to network clients.
A. You need an IPv4 address for a specific instance.
D. You want to avoid making changes to your security groups.
B. You need an IPv6 address for a specific instance.
answers: C. You want to mask the failure of an instance to network clients.

question: 183. Which of the following can you not do with an elastic IP address?
options: D. Associate it with a single instance in a VPC.
A. Change the IP address associated with it while it is in use.
B. Move it from one instance to another.
C. Move it across VPCs.
answers: A. Change the IP address associated with it while it is in use.

question: 184. Which of the following are advantages of an elastic IP? (Choose two.)
options: A. Reduces the number of IP addresses your VPC uses
D. Provides multiple IP addresses for a single instance
B. Provides protection in case of an instance failure
C. Allows all attributes of a network interface to be moved at one time
answers: B. Provides protection in case of an instance failure
C. Allows all attributes of a network interface to be moved at one time

question: 185. Which of the following would you need to do to create an elastic IP address? (Choose two.)
options: A. Allocate an elastic IP address for use in a VPC.
D. Associate the elastic IP to an instance in your VPC.
C. Detach the primary network interface on an instance.
B. Allocate an IP address in Route 53.
answers: A. Allocate an elastic IP address for use in a VPC.
D. Associate the elastic IP to an instance in your VPC.

question: 186. Which of these is not a valid means of working with an Amazon EBS snapshot?
options: D. The AWS EBS management tool
C. The AWS console
B. The AWS CLI
A. The AWS API
answers: D. The AWS EBS management tool

question: 187. Where are individual instances provisioned?
options: B. In a region
A. In a VPC
D. In an Auto Scaling group
C. In an availability zone
answers: C. In an availability zone

question: 188. How are EBS snapshots backed up to S3?
options: C. EBS snapshots are backed up to RDS.
A. Incrementally
D. Sequentially
B. In full, every time they are changed
answers: A. Incrementally

question: 189. You have an existing IAM role in use by several instances in your VPC. You make a change in the role, removing permissions to access S3. When does this change take effect on the instances already attached to the role?
options: C. The next time the instances are restarted
D. The instances preserve the pre-change permissions indefinitely.
B. Within 60 seconds
A. Immediately
answers: A. Immediately

question: 190. How many IAM roles can you attach to a single instance?
options: D. None, roles are not assigned to instances.
A. One
B. One or two
C. As many as you want
answers: A. One

question: 191. How can you attach multiple IAM roles to a single instance? (Choose two.)
options: C. You can assign two IAM roles to an instance, but no more than that.
D. You cannot; only one role can be assigned to an instance.
A. You can attach as many roles as you want to an instance.
B. You cannot, but you can combine the policies each role uses into a single new role and assign that.
answers: D. You cannot; only one role can be assigned to an instance.
B. You cannot, but you can combine the policies each role uses into a single new role and assign that.

question: 192. You need to make a change to a role attached to a running instance. What do you need to do to ensure the least amount of downtime? (Choose two.)
options: D. Other than updating the role, no additional changes are needed.
A. Update the IAM role via the console or AWS API or CLI.
C. Restart the instance.
B. Re-attach the updated role to the instance.
answers: A. Update the IAM role via the console or AWS API or CLI.
D. Other than updating the role, no additional changes are needed.

question: 193. You have a new set of permissions that you want to attach to a running instance. What do you need to do to ensure the least amount of downtime? (Choose two.)
options: D. Attach the new role to the running instance.
C. Stop the instance, assign the role, and restart the instance.
A. Remove the instance’s IAM role via the console or AWS API or CLI.
B. Create a new IAM role with the desired permissions.
answers: D. Attach the new role to the running instance.
B. Create a new IAM role with the desired permissions.

question: 194. How can you delete a snapshot of an EBS volume when it’s used as the root device of a registered AMI?
options: A. You can’t.
B. You can, but only using the AWS API or CLI.
C. Delete the snapshot using the AWS console.
D. Ensure that you have correct IAM privileges and delete the AMI.
answers: A. You can’t.

question: 195. Which of these is the best option for encrypting data at rest on an EBS volume?
options: C. Configure encryption using the OS tools on the attached EC2 instance.
B. Configure AES 256 encryption on the volume once it’s been started.
D. Back up the data in the volume to an encrypted S3 bucket.
A. Configure the volume’s encryption at creation time.
answers: A. Configure the volume’s encryption at creation time.

question: 196. How can you ensure that an EBS root volume persists beyond the life of an EC2 instance, in the event that the instance is terminated?
options: B. Configure the EC2 instance to not terminate its root volume and the EBS volume to persist.
D. Ensure that encryption is enabled on the volume and it will automatically persist.
A. The volume will persist automatically.
C. You cannot; root volumes always are deleted when the attached EC2 instance is terminated.
answers: B. Configure the EC2 instance to not terminate its root volume and the EBS volume to persist.

question: 197. Which of the following is not part of the well-architected framework?
options: D. Automate responses to security events.
C. Use defaults whenever possible.
B. Enable traceability.
A. Apply security at all layers.
answers: C. Use defaults whenever possible.

question: 198. Which of the following should you attempt to automate, according to the AWS wellarchitected framework? (Choose two.)
options: D. IAM policy creation
B. Scaling instances
C. Responses to security events
A. Security best practices
answers: C. Responses to security events
A. Security best practices

question: 199. Which of the following statements are true? (Choose two.)
options: D. You are responsible for security of the cloud.
A. You are responsible for security in the cloud.
C. AWS is responsible for security in the cloud.
B. AWS is responsible for security of the cloud.
answers: A. You are responsible for security in the cloud.
B. AWS is responsible for security of the cloud.

question: 200. For which of the following is AWS responsible for security? (Choose two.)
options: A. Edge locations
D. Availability zones
B. Firewall configuration
C. Network traffic
answers: A. Edge locations
D. Availability zones
